transaction_description: NATIONAL CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ECONOMICS (NCEE) MISSION SUPPORT CONTRACT - NATURAL RESOURCES PROTECTION: TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ECONOMICS RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS  THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO DE-OBLIGATE -$98,000.00 FROM OPT
prime_award_base_transaction_description: NATIONAL CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ECONOMICS (NCEE) MISSION SUPPORT CONTRACT - NATURAL RESOURCES PROTECTION: TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR ENVIRONMENTAL ECONOMICS RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS  UNDER THIS CONTRACT, THE CONTRACTOR SHALL RESEARCH, EVALUATE AND ANALYZE DATA IN THE AREAS MENTIONED ABOVE, AS IT RELATES TO THE AGENCY'S REGULATORY AND NON-REGULATORY PROGRAMS.  THIS SHALL INCLUDE AGENCY POLICIES THAT IMPACT SECTORS OF THE ECONOMY THAT RELY ON CONSUMPTIVE AND NON-CONSUMPTIVE USES OF DOMESTIC AND SOME INTERNATIONAL NATURAL RESOURCES AND ENVIRONMENT TO INCLUDE FOOD AND FIBER PRODUCTION, AGRIBUSINESS, AND PROCESSING, FORESTRY, MINING, AND RECREATION/TOURISM.  SPECIFIC TYPES OF ANALYSES UNDER THIS CONTRACT SHALL INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: ENVIRONMENTAL RELEASE ANALYSES, INCLUDING FATE AND TRANSPORT, HUMAN AND ECOLOGICAL EXPOSURE ASSESSMENTS, DOSE RESPONSE ANALYSIS, AND QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE ASSESSMENT OF RISK TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT.  IN ADDITION, WORK UNDER THIS CONTRACT MAY REQUIRE THE CONTRACTOR TO ASSESS: ECONOMIC IMPACTS, EFFECTS ON TRADE, IMPACTS ON SPECIFIC MARKETS, AND BEHAVIORAL RESPONSES TO ENVIRONMENTAL DEGRADATION AND REGULATION.     IGF::CL::IGF

transaction_description: THE PURPOSE OF THIS MODIFICATION IS TO EXERCISE OPTION YEAR 3 AND TO ADD INCREMENTAL FUNDING.
prime_award_base_transaction_description: THIS REQUIREMENT IS FOR OPERATION OF THE REGION 9 BUSINESS CENTER. AN EFFICIENT, WELL-MANAGED BUSINESS CENTER IS ESSENTIAL TO ACCOMPLISHING THE MISSION AND GOALS OF REGION 9. THE BUSINESS CENTER (CENTER) INCLUDES THE SUPPLY CENTER, ERGONOMIC SUPPLIES AND INVENTORY, SHIPPING AND RECEIVING, PICKUP AND DELIVERY, MAIL SERVICES, PHOTOCOPY/REPRODUCTION FUNCTIONS, CONFERENCE ROOM SETUP AND RECYCLING OPERATIONS.  THE CENTER IS LOCATED IN THE REGION 9 MAIN OFFICE AT 75 HAWTHORNE ST, SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA. THE CONTRACTOR IS RESPONSIBLE FOR CONDUCTING BUSINESS, BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 7:30 AM TO 6:00 PM MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY EXCLUDING FEDERAL HOLIDAYS, ADMINISTRATIVE CLOSINGS OR SIMILAR GOVERNMENT DIRECTED FACILITY CLOSINGS. IN THE CASE OF AN EMERGENCY, OPERATIONAL HOURS MAY BE EXPANDED TO 12 HOURS A DAY, SEVEN DAYS A WEEK (MONDAY THROUGH SUNDAY, 7:00 A.M. TO 7:00 P.M., HOLIDAYS EXCLUDED). IN THE CASE OF A CONTINUITY OF OPERATIONS (COOP) SITUATION, BUSINESS CENTER SERVICES MAY BE REQUIRED AT THE COOP SITE. THIS SERVICE MAY BE IN ADDITION TO SERVICE REQUIRED AT THE CENTER AT 75 HAWTHORNE STREET, SAN FRANCISCO, CA. THE COOP SITE CAN BE LOCATED ANYWHERE WITHIN THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA. SITE INFORMATION WILL BE PROVIDED AT TIME OF EMERGENCY.

THESE CONTRACTS REQUIRE PERSONNEL TO DELIVER THE FOLLOWING SERVICES: FIELD WORK AND ANALYTICAL SUPPORT, TREATABILITY STUDIES, REMEDIAL INVESTIGATION-FEASIBILITY STUDIES, ENGINEERING EVALUATION-COST ANALYSIS, REMEDIAL DESIGN, OVERSIGHT OR OVERSIGHT SUPPORT AND OTHER GENERAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.
